text: The adolescent must never be treated as a child, for that is a stage of life that he has surpassed. It is better to treat an adolescent as if he had greater value than he actually shows than as if he had less and let him feel that his merits and self-respect are disregarded.
author: Maria Montessori

text: The land is the source of all life, and the children who work on it, producing food, gain a sense of the cosmic order of things and of the part they play in the scheme of existence.
author: Maria Montessori

text: The essential thing is to arouse such an interest that it engages the child's whole personality.
author: Maria Montessori

text: Education should no longer be mostly imparting of knowledge, but must take a new path, seeking the release of human potentialities.
author: Maria Montessori

text: The greatest sign of success for a teacher is to be able to say, 'The children are now working as if I did not exist.'
author: Maria Montessori

text: Free the child's potential, and you will transform him into the world.
author: Maria Montessori
